levelledPara.title: General
levelledPara.para: The reference frame system gives the standard coordinate system for the aircraft. Use the reference frame system to identify the position of components and structures.

levelledPara.title: Datum Points
levelledPara.para: The datum points are the fixed reference positions on the aircraft. The primary datum is at the nose of the fuselage.

levelledPara.title: Station (STA)
levelledPara.para: Stations are the distances along the fuselage from the nose datum. Stations increase from the nose to the tail. Station 0 is at the nose datum.

levelledPara.title: Waterline (WL)
levelledPara.para: Waterlines are the vertical distances from a horizontal reference plane. Waterline 0 is at the bottom of the fuselage.

levelledPara.title: Buttock Line (BL)
levelledPara.para: Buttock lines are the lateral distances from the fuselage centerline. Buttock line 0 is at the centerline. Positive values are on the right side, negative values are on the left side.

levelledPara.title: Reference Grid
levelledPara.para: The reference grid shows the intersection of stations, waterlines, and buttock lines. Use the reference grid to find the position of aircraft components.
Note: Refer to the reference frame drawings for the exact position of datum points and grid lines.
